HMEP - HAZARDOUS MATERIAL EMERGENCY PLANNING - HAZMAT EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS PLANNING AND TRAINING GRANT WILL SUPPORT INTER-TRIBAL COUNCIL OF ARIZONA IN DEVELOPING EMERGENCY PLANS UNDER THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-TO-KNOW ACT OF 1986.

IAFC PROPOSES TO TRAIN APPROXIMATELY 15,250 PEOPLE BY REVIEWING AND UPDATING THEIR COMMUNITY SAFETY: EMERGENCY PLANNING RESPONSE AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS. BY EXPANDING AND ENHANCING THE SCOPE TO ADDRESS EMERGING NEEDS AND REQUIREMENTS IDENTIFIED BY THE COMMUNITY AND BY CONDUCTING 10 INSTRUCTOR-LED TRAINING COURSES AND TABLETOP EXERCISES. IAFC ALSO PROPOSES TO DEVELOP AND RELEASE FOUR (4) MINI VIDEOS; AND DEVELOP AND CONDUCT A COMMODITY FLOW SURVEY WORKSHOP.

*ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PERFORMANCE EVALUATION AND RISK ASSESSMENT OF EXCESSIVE CATHODIC PROTECTION ON VINTAGE PIPELINE COATINGS
*DELIVERABLES/EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPROVED PERFORMANCE EVALUATION AND RISK ASSESSMENT.
*INTENDED BENEFICIARY: NATION WIDE PIPELINE BENEFITS.
*SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO KNOWN SUBRECIPIENTS
